title: [BUG] STC and HiveCote classifiers error: Input X contains NaN....
body:
Hello everyone,
When running my code I get the following error message:
"ValueError: Input X contains NaN. RotationForest does not accept missing values encoded as NaN natively...."
I checked my dataset and it doesn't have NULL values.
np.isnan(X_train_dim0_3d).any() -- FALSE
np.isfinite(X_train_dim0_3d).any() -- TRUE


Above the code. The dataset can be download [here](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/13Xud8emW10pzUyxEbToZwDdhk7qGXPpk?usp=share_link)

```python
from sktime.classification.interval_based import TimeSeriesForestClassifier, RandomIntervalSpectralEnsemble, CanonicalIntervalForest, DrCIF
from sktime.classification.hybrid import HIVECOTEV1, HIVECOTEV2
from sktime.classification.kernel_based import Arsenal, RocketClassifier
from sktime.datatypes._panel._convert import from_nested_to_3d_numpy
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score, f1_score, confusion_matrix
from sktime.datasets import load_from_tsfile_to_dataframe
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split, cross_validate, RepeatedStratifiedKFold, RepeatedKFold
from sktime.classification.shapelet_based import ShapeletTransformClassifier

X, y = load_from_tsfile_to_dataframe('Driving signal Classification SAMPLING/Driving signal Classification SAMPLING_FULL.ts')

# clf_uni=HIVECOTEV1(
#                  stc_params={"n_shapelet_samples": 100000},
#                  tsf_params={"n_estimators": 50},
#                  rise_params={"n_estimators": 200},
#                  cboss_params={"n_parameter_samples": 200, "max_ensemble_size": 100},
#                  n_jobs=-1
#              )
#clf_uni=TimeSeriesForestClassifier(n_estimators=50, n_jobs=-1)
clf_uni = RocketClassifier(num_kernels=10000)
#clf_uni = RandomIntervalSpectralEnsemble(n_estimators=10, n_jobs=-1)
#clf_uni = ShapeletTransformClassifier(n_shapelet_samples=100000, n_jobs=-1)

X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y, random_state=42)
X_train_dim0 = X_train.iloc[:,0].to_frame()
X_test_dim0 = X_test.iloc[:,0].to_frame()
#X_train_dim0_3d = from_nested_to_3d_numpy(X_train_dim0)
#X_test_dim0_3d = from_nested_to_3d_numpy(X_test_dim0)

print("Train classifier")
clf_uni.fit(X_train_dim0,y_train)
print("Classify data")
y_pred = clf_uni.predict(X_test_dim0)
print('Evaluate performance')
print(accuracy_score(y_test, y_pred))
```

**Expected behavior**
The classifiers: STC and HIVECOTE work

**Additional context**
<!--
Add any other context about the problem here.
-->

**Versions**
I'm using Python 3.8 and SKTIME 0.15.


</details>
